key_points: The Suez Canal blockage by the Ever Given is estimated to cost Egypt about $1 billion in damages.
Lt. Gen. Ossama Rabei, head of Suez Canal Authority, states compensation will cover lost transit fees, and the cost of dredging and tugboats.
The ship's captain has not responded to requests for the black box or documents for the investigation.
Ever Given will be detained until the investigation is complete.
The grounding halted over 400 ships and closed the canal for six days.
Workers dredged 30,000 cubic meters of sand to free the Ever Given.
The incident sparked national pride in Egypt for overcoming the technical challenge.
Investigation will examine human error or mechanical failure in the grounding.
Suez Canal Authority may file a civil lawsuit if the ship's operators do not cooperate.
Plans to upgrade the Suez Canal include increasing daily ship capacity and enhancing support resources.
spokespersons: Lt. Gen. Ossama Rabei (Head of Suez Canal Authority)
